page.title: 16Plains Farm Estate (cont)
page.content: The{social club}caters for all sorts of sporting activities, having football, bowling, snooker and pigeon sections. For younger people a former civil defence post in Portland Road now acts as a club and disco. Not far from the workman's club is{Clay's {Nursery and Garden Centre}which is very popular with visitors at weekends. At point of interest here is that during the Second World War, when it belonged to a gentleman named Bailey, prisoners of war worked on the land and in the greenhouses. In 1973 Premier Road, which originally ended at the bottom of Tudor Grove, was extended to join Silksworth Lane and form a direct link to the town.
